headline: The Breakfast Battle: Convenience Stores Are Taking a Bite Out of Fast-Food Chains' Morning Revenues
summary: Food-forward convenience stores are becoming a morning staple for a growing number of consumers, market research firm Circana finds. According to the company's U.S. C-Store Landscape Q2 2025 report, morning meal trips at convenience stores were up by 1% over the last three-month period. Breakfast trips now account for 25% of all convenience store food purchases. "Over the long run, convenience stores have taken share, really at foodservice overall, but the morning meal has been their strong suit
